result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

09:00 AM Attorney Aaron R Anderson in court by zoom.   Defendant Johnny E Reed did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.

State will forward offer.  Hearing scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.

  **Reviewed by Judge Bugenhagen on 08-04-2022: Attorney may appear by zoom.**
declined by Judge Bugenhagen Jr. on July 8, 2022. Motion was withdrawn.
Hearing on August 5, 2022 at 08:45 am.

03:42 PM Defendant Johnny E Reed in court, in custody, with attorney Aaron R Anderson.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.
Atty Anderson states his client no longer contests the matter and does request a new date. 
Defendant does agree he is competent and ready to proceed. 
State would request court rely on doctors report. 
Court will set matter for a new date. 
Atty Anderson requests the court deny the motion to withdraw.  Hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 08:45 am.
Competency hearing on July 7, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

09:05 AM Defendant Johnny E Reed in court, in custody, with attorney Aaron R Anderson.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All parties have received the doctors reports.  Atty Anderson did not go over the report with the defendant. 
Defendant did not want to review with his counsel.
State requests court to rely on doctors reports. 
Defendant is unsure if he is competent or not. 
Court will not discharge counsel at this time. 
Court will set a hearing date on competency issue.  Competency hearing scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Order to withdraw as counsel filed by Atty. Aaron Anderson
filed by Atty. Aaron Anderson

To be done as an outpatient basis within 30 days.  Preliminary time limits waived.    Bail remains as fixed.  Review hearing scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 08:15 am.

records.addlTxt: Atty. Aaron Anderson
Bail/bond hearing on February 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Bail Motion filed by Attorney Anderson
Hearing on February 11, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 4 supervision.  Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.

02:20 PM Defendant Johnny E Reed in court, in custody.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and reads the criminal complaint to the defendant on the record.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for February 11, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
